title: Photograph of two water carriers Series of six carte de visite portraits by August Sachtler

  physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white portrait photograph. It features two men
 both carrying cannisters. The man on the left is squatting on the ground
 while the man on the right is standing and carrying the cannisters on a stick on his shoulder. Both are wearing loose tops and trousers
 with a wrap cloth around the waist. The photograph is quite faded and stained. There are no inscriptions
 tears
 or folds seen.

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: \This is part of a series of small carte de visite format portrait photographs by August Sachtler
 a German photographer who started photographing in Singapore in the early 1860s. The studio details inscribed on the back of these cartes de visite read \\A. Sachtler in Singapore\\

metadata.title_text: Photograph of two water carriers Series of six carte de visite portraits by August Sachtler
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white portrait photograph. It features two men, both carrying cannisters. The man on the left is squatting on the ground, while the man on the right is standing and carrying the cannisters on a stick on his shoulder. Both are wearing loose tops and trousers, with a wrap cloth around the waist. The photograph is quite faded and stained. There are no inscriptions, tears, or folds seen.
metadata.subject_terms_1: occupations (livelihoods) ways of life indigenous people portraits folk costume
metadata.subject_terms_2: Occupations Ethnic costume Lifestyles Portrait photography Indigenous people Carte de visite photographs
metadata.sgcool_label_text: "This is part of a series of small carte de visite format portrait photographs by August Sachtler, a German photographer who started photographing in Singapore in the early 1860s. The studio details inscribed on the back of these cartes de visite read ""A. Sachtler in Singapore""
